basel_Baa: Eagle with Basel Crosier, Single-Headed, B.a.a.

Watermark B.a.a. can be distinguished by three features: its eagle contains a Basel crosier, its foot on the beak side stays in, but does not cross, a chain line, and below it are the letters ID (marked with red).

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints(all small format):

  • Self-portrait (?) with plumed cap and lowered saber,1634, Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam.
  • Self-portrait (?) with plumed cap and lowered saber,1634, Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg.
  • Abraham casting out Hagar and Ishmael, 1637, Hermitage Museum, St. Petersburg.
  • Man crying out 'Tis bitterly cold', 1634, Frits Lugt Collection, Institut Néerlandais, Paris.
  • Man replying 'Not at all', circa 1634, Frits Lugt Collection, Institut Néerlandais, Paris.
  • Woman reading,1634, Philadelphia Museum of Art.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 106)
